instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Green Light - OK
PPBUS_G3H - OK
PP3V42_G3H - OK
PP5V_S5 - OK
PP5V_S0 - 2.20v and drop for 0v (turn on and off fan)

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: is this on-off loop or just on-off once???

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER], yes in loop. ON and OFF

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: check R7402....

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Checked! Looks fine

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Looks fine? Measure it!
If R7402 is ok then measure voltage on Y2805 should not exceed 1.6V else clock chip is dead. 
I assume this was a liquid damage?

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: A mean: I measure and is fine! Yes, liquid damage.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: if resistance over C7050 doesn't exceed 2.2 to 4 ohms then U2800 is probably dead. so check duke's advice because that is the best way to tell if U2800 is dead. i am also going to guess your liquid damage was on the rim, by either vp0r sensor, thunderbolt area, or smc. even if the clock chip has no corrosion or water on it, just water in that area, it means it is dead..

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] I replaced U2800 and works (fan spin), but i don't backlight.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Got image without backlight? Read the sticky post about the backlight applies to 2936 too.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Yes, no image or chime. And yes, the model is 820-2936

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
What is is not?? You say no backlight and now there is no image or chime......
Connect a USB mouse and see if it lights up, CPU Vcore present?

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER], i have light in the mouse(usb). I will check Vcore

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Ppcpuvccio_so - 1.05v
smc_cpu_isense - 0v
ppvoce_so_cpu_ph1 - 0.76v

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Board is working. Connect a known good LCD and hold a flashlight to the back of the Apple logo to check if there is an image.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
Yes, i have folder question mark.
Backlight is a problem right now.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message: Read the sticky on backlight repair. Post some measurements here.

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
bkl_pwm - 0v
bkl_en - 0v
l9701 - 0.66v
f9700 - 12v

threads.title: 820-2936-B - Turn ON and OFF
threads.message:
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Resistance to ground on pin 4 of u9701:[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
BKL_PWM  2.5[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial][SIZE=16px]Ω[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
